snippet.textDisplay:
There are birds too :D
Exploration is my favorite part of pretty much every game that its possible in... But not in SotC. It wasn't even the monotony, it's just that everything looked so similar that if I went the wrong way it took too much time finding my way back, so it was generally quicker just to restart and try another path.
snippet.textOriginal:
There are birds too :D

snippet.textDisplay:
Whenever I hear the moment 0:00 - 1:15, I think of the following situation:

A battlefield where, on one side, there are heroes from video games and on the other one are the greatest villains for games. Then, they engage in epic duel, of which poems will be sung!
snippet.textOriginal:
Whenever I hear the moment 0:00 - 1:15, I think of the following situation:

A battlefield where, on one side, there are heroes from video games and on the other one are the greatest villains for games. Then, they engage in epic duel, of which poems will be sung!

snippet.textDisplay: I agree game was epic, but technical wise it wasn't anything special. The very idea was excellent, but there are better looking games for ps2.

this game was the definition of epic when it was released. 

one of the few ps2 games that really demands a ps3 remake since it pushed the ps2's technical abilities so hard.

snippet.textDisplay: Shadow of the Colossus was a very, very Hayao Miyazaki experience.
snippet.textOriginal: Shadow of the Colossus was a very, very Hayao Miyazaki experience.

snippet.textDisplay:
About the controls, well you can change them, I instinctly remapped jump to X, and horse to triangle, that felt more natural for me.

It was more of a beautiful, atmospheric experience than a game for me, that's why I'm so forgiving of it's faults, I love it XD
snippet.textOriginal:
About the controls, well you can change them, I instinctly remapped jump to X, and horse to triangle, that felt more natural for me.

It was more of a beautiful, atmospheric experience than a game for me, that's why I'm so forgiving of it's faults, I love it XD

snippet.textDisplay:
i'm beating the game this weekend because on monday i'm going to sell it again. 
the controlls are a pain in the ***. i paid so much for it. 
it looked so promising: huge bosses, great atmosphere, impressive soundtrack but the controls killed it for me...
snippet.textOriginal:
i'm beating the game this weekend because on monday i'm going to sell it again. 
the controlls are a pain in the ***. i paid so much for it. 
it looked so promising: huge bosses, great atmosphere, impressive soundtrack but the controls killed it for me...

snippet.textDisplay:
Epic stuff, like the rest of the OST, but I like this track better. 

/watch?v=GrFL2zPc2uk&fmt=18

It's in the same vein but it sounds more defeated, more inquisitive. As if it's trying to tell Wander what he is doing isn't the right thing, but he isn't listening. 

... I talk too much.

snippet.textDisplay: I agree with you.  That is by far my favorite fight.  Riding your horse and jumping from it to mount the collosus never gets old.  It also has my favorite song from the game playing while doing so :P

snippet.textDisplay:
Only one song from SotC so far? Be ashamed!

The Opened Way, Counterattack, Epilogue, Prologue, Demise of the Ritual and Memories (PAL bonus track) should all be in the list as well, but Revived Power is indeed still one of my favourites. When it's used during the fight with Basaran (#9) it just blew me away.
snippet.textOriginal:
Only one song from SotC so far? Be ashamed!

The Opened Way, Counterattack, Epilogue, Prologue, Demise of the Ritual and Memories (PAL bonus track) should all be in the list as well, but Revived Power is indeed still one of my favourites. When it's used during the fight with Basaran (#9) it just blew me away.
